intro: Seringia platyphylla, commonly known as the broadleaf seringia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Seringia platyphylla is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
